title: Index
text:
Welcome
This website is your home for economic and financial analysis using data provided by the Federal Reserve Economic Database (FRED) from the St. Louis Fed.
Read more at my blog Between the Pipes.

title: About
text:
This site provides a curated set of economic and market indicators, updated daily, to give a snapshot of U.S. macroeconomic trends and financial market performance.
Each chart is interactive and designed for quick interpretation.



What it shows: The historical performance of the S&P 500 index, including monthly returns heatmaps and a daily price chart.
How to read it:
- In the Monthly Returns heatmap, warmer colors indicate stronger returns, cooler colors indicate weaker or negative returns.
- The Daily Chart shows closing prices over time. Hover over any point to see the exact date and value.




What it shows: The University of Michigan’s Consumer Sentiment Index, a measure of how optimistic or pessimistic consumers feel about the economy.
How to read it: Higher values indicate greater confidence, often linked to stronger consumer spending.




What it shows: Quarterly changes in U.S. real Gross Domestic Product (GDP), adjusted for inflation.
How to read it: Bars above zero indicate economic expansion; bars below zero indicate contraction.




What it shows: The percentage of the labor force that is unemployed and actively seeking work.
How to read it: A falling unemployment rate generally signals labor market strength, while a rising rate may indicate economic weakness.




What it shows: The year-over-year percentage change in the Consumer Price Index, a measure of price changes for goods and services.
How to read it: Higher CPI growth means rising inflation; negative values indicate deflation.




What it shows: Indexed price trends for major asset classes, including Bitcoin, the Nasdaq-100, the S&P 500, home prices, and commodity prices, all rebased to January 2021.
How to read it: All series start at 100 in Jan 2021; values above 100 show growth since then, values below 100 show declines.

Tip: Hover over any chart to see exact values and dates. Most charts allow zooming and panning for closer analysis.
